translated:
Ernfrid Hilding Valdemar, high school teacher, principal, Ronneby, born on February 20, 1791 in Nordmark, Värmland County, son of A. W. Westberg and Augusta Bengtsson. Married to Gunda Winberg in 1818. Children: Björn Hilding Sture, born on February 20. Education: Completed secondary school in Karlstad in 1811, received a bachelor's degree in Uppsala in 1817, attended a licentiate course at Stockholm University in 1821-1822, and served as a temporary teacher in Gävle in 1817, Strömstad in 1818-1819, Katarina High School in Stockholm in 1819, Karlstad People's School-Seminary in 1820, Norra Latin High School in Stockholm in 1820-1822, Nya Elementarläroverket in Stockholm in 1822-1823, Karolinska High School in Örebro in 1823-1831, and biology teacher at Betelseminarium in Stockholm from 1821-1823. Became an adjunct biology teacher with health science and chemistry at Ronneby Real School in 1831, and later became the principal of Ronneby City Vocational School in 1845. Member of the church council since 1839, vice chairman of the school board from 1839 to 1846, member of the city council since 1843, member of the family welfare committee since 1844, civil defense chief in the Ronneby civil defense district from 1944 to 1946, and department and board member of the National Teachers Association since 1942. Also served on the exhibition committee for the home crafts exhibition in Strömstad in 1919. Author of the book "Dy rörts systemets överdrifter" (The Exaggerations of the Movement System) in 1944, and wrote articles on salary and taxation issues. 

Sven Ivan Kristoffer, industrial manager, Ekenässjön, born on January 17, 1883 in Kläckeberga, Kalmar County, son of estate manager J. P. Westberg and Sofie Högländer. Married to Edith Zyrner in 1932. Children: Anne-Sofie, born in 1912, Maj in 1913, Britta in 1918, Elsbeth in 1936. Worked at Lindefors Glassworks from 1902 to 1907, Bergdala from 1907 to 1913, Pukeberg from 1914 to 1918, Airboga from 1919 to 1922, and has been working at Ekenäs since 1926. Served as chairman of the Swedish Glass Export Association and the Bottle Manufacturers' Association, and board member of the Swedish Small Glassworks Association and the Household Glass Factory Association. Also served as a member of the municipal council, church council, road board, tax committee and treasurer of the school board. Received the Royal Order of the North Star (RNO) and the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO). 

Westborg, Eaias, bank director, Växjö, born on June 2, 1888 in Södra Hestra, Jönköping County, son of John Nilsson and Emma Westborg. Married to Karin Swenson in 1924. Children: Jodin-Erik, born in 1928, Sven-Magnus in 1932, Bengt-Johan in 1936. Completed secondary school in 1908. Worked at Sydsvenska Kredit AB in Lund from 1910, becoming the head cashier in 1915. Later worked as a cashier in Linköping in 1917, and then in Mariestad in 1918. Joined Växjö Savings Bank in the same year and became a chamberlain in 1926, and then the managing director of the bank in 1933. Also served as a board member of various organizations and was a member of the Växjö Interest and Capital Insurance Institution since 1925. Owns properties in Växjö. Served as chairman of the county savings bank association, vice chairman of the Savings Bank Guarantee Association, board substitute of the Savings Banks Bank AB and the Savings Promotion Publishing AB, auditor of the Swedish Savings Association, treasurer of the Association for Småland's Antiquities and Cultural History, and commissioner for the cities' defense agency. Traveled to Germany, Holland, Belgium, France, Italy, and Switzerland in 1923. Author of the book "Kronob. 1. sparb. 1828-1928" (Kronoberg County Savings Bank 1828-1928). Member of the Rotary Club. Hobbies include sailing and sport fishing. Received the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO).
